head.title: The Roads a Woman Can Take

hedline.hl1: The Roads a Woman Can Take

abstract.p: Laura Gross letter on Maureen Dowd's June 7 column; warns that young women already tired of daily grind are in for rude awakening if they ever have real problems (S)

block.p: Re ''Rescue Me, Please!'', by Maureen Dowd (column, June 7):
I hope this is not really what women in the year 2000 are thinking. How can a 23-year-old woman already be sick of the daily grind? She has not even given her new life a chance.
Re ''Rescue Me, Please!'', by Maureen Dowd (column, June 7):
I hope this is not really what women in the year 2000 are thinking. How can a 23-year-old woman already be sick of the daily grind? She has not even given her new life a chance.
Women can still wear feminine clothes and don matching purses, but that does not mean that they have to give up their careers.
I hope these women in their 20's and 30's never get a divorce, have the misfortune of having their husband die, or go bankrupt, because they are in for a rude awakening.
Women are not going to get anywhere in life or in their careers with attitudes like this.
